snippet: Field Marshal Mohamed Hussein Tantawi challenged the Muslim Brotherhood by saying the army would prevent Egypt from falling to a “certain group,” according to the state news agency.
abstract: Egypt's Field Marshal Mohamed Hussein Tantawi steps up his feud with the Muslim Brotherhood, saying the army would prevent Egypt from falling to a 'certain group'; remarks, widely seen as a reference to the Brotherhood and to Mohamed Morsi, nation's newly elected president and former Brotherhood leader, come just hours after Sec of State Hillary Clinton met with Tantawi in effort to prod Egypt’s military to hand its power to civilians.
lead_paragraph: Field Marshal Mohamed Hussein Tantawi challenged the Muslim Brotherhood by saying the army would prevent Egypt from falling to a “certain group,” according to the state news agency.

headline.seo: Egypt Military Aide Meets Clinton, Then Steps Up Political Feud
headline.main: After Meeting With Clinton, Egypt’s Military Chief Steps Up Political Feud
headline.print_headline: After Meeting With Clinton, Egypt’s Military Chief Steps Up Political Feud
